Reviews.Title: “breakfast location in a garden on the top of the hotel, lot of light plus view on the city: nice way to wake up!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrGreen78
Reviews.Content: Wonderful breakfast location in a garden on the top of the hotel, lot of light view on the city: nice way to wake up!!! Really comfortable hotel, near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “friendly but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Christoph l
Reviews.Content: The hotel has somewhat of a taste of grandeur past and is located in one of the less favoured parts of the capital. It's nevertheless clean with huge rooms and adequate bathrooms. It is also quiet, and many of the rooms overlook a tranquil and rather beautiful central courtyard. Breakfasts are ample and enthusiastically served, if you are lucky and the weather is good then sitting on the roof terrace is a real pleasure. So if you are after somewhere off the beaten path and don't want to pay for the glitz of better known more trendy hotels, this is a very sound choice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly low standards for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Divina_11
Reviews.Content: Hard to imagine that in a four star hotel one would stay without hot running water - twice in less than 1 week residence. The first night I arrived I went down at the reception with a list of complaints: - no heating in the room (I could hear quite a loud noise of the AC working but, the room temperature would not change at all), - the telephone with no signal, - and most importantly no hot water for the shower!!! The only proposal coming from the reception was changing my room with another bigger one (as if that was the problem!). I did not accept any foolish proposal and waited until next morning to have shower. In addition, the telephone got its signal back but the AC was never working. I had to lower my expectations and accept that situation up to the third day of my stay. I woke up at around 10 am and prepared for shower - guess what, hot water still missing!!! This time, called the reception and asked to be transferred to another hotel... The answer this time was: wait for 40 mins for the problem to be fixed. It got indeed fixed after 40 mins, but I was waking up the next 2 days cross-checking for services that I believe (mostly sure) even a one-star hotel would have provided. Not to mention the quality of the food served in the morning buffet...The famous Italian coffee? Better buy some instant nescafe than try the one offered by the hotel... I have seen other couples in the hotel staying mute in front of common problems and I just can't accept this attitude... Wondering of the excellent online reviews... Was it my fault that I happened to be a guest of the hotel at a low season? I paid the normal price and did not even ask for extra services - just the basics... So finally, really hoping that my herein message will either help with the clients' decision-making or make the hotel respect all the contractual obligations deriving from their current star-standing (in at least the basic standards that has to be provided to the customers)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: IamChuckC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ateneo Garden Palace is a wonderful hotel, with spacious, comfortable rooms, pleasant and competent staff, and good breakfasts. And, it's in a good location! You can walk to Termini station in about 10 minutes, and yet the hotel area is quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a big city”
Reviews.Author: jdayPadova
Reviews.Content: I seem to collect quiet hotels and this is one - its fundamental to know that after a hard day touristing or conferencing then you'll get a good nights sleep. This hotel is close to the station - 10 minute walk - and was perfect for the Conference I had to attend last week. Price 130 euros for a queen size bed.Found staff were alert and quick to please - not always easy to find in Italy I must say. Internal garden looked very pleasant for a drink, chat or email session. I was only there briefly but the WIFI worked fine and the breakfast room is a cheery glassed area on the 4th floor - not much of a view - it looks over private flats and houses. There were a couple of homeless in the park out the front but really harmless. For tourism you will need to use public transport to get to sites.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bugs”
Reviews.Author: pucktraveler
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station - about a five to ten-minute walk to the station and to the plaza surrounding the train station. The air conditioning did not work during our stay ... and when we opened the window in our room, overlooking the courtyard, bugs came into our room. Our room was on the second floor and was a loft-style room, with steps from the entrance going up to the bed. The television did not work. Breakfast, however, was very good - a continental-style breakfast with everything from eggs and bacon to croissants and nutella, pastries and lots of Italian coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A very good compromise”
Reviews.Author: Jtraveler01
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at the University Sapienza for a few days. I was on my own to tour the city. The desk help was very knowledgeable with directions and recommendations. The breakfast area was lovely but the variety of choices was not plentiful. Again, the service personnel were helpful. The neighborhood was convenient to the University but not to tourist areas. This was ok. I took a lot of buses. The TV only offered News in English. There was WiFi, but worked only 50% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: calamityBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful. Good selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: searcher33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.The hotel is an early 20th century liberty style building.The reception staff spoke good English and were helpful.Our room was spacious and clean.We slept well because the hotel was quiet and the bed was comfortable.The free Wi-Fi internet access worked well. The continental breakfast buffet is served on the fourth floor terrace with good views of the garden.You can buy a drink at the bar and enjoy it in the lounge or out in the garden.The hotel doesn't have a restaurant serving dinner so we ate in the centre of Rome or in the suburb where the hotel is located.Some Americans told us that 4 star hotels in Italy are equivalent to 3 star hotels in the U.S. The outdoor garden was nice.We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever and will tell everyone I know”
Reviews.Author: TamTamG72
Reviews.Content: Customer service was excellent. Rooms were very clean, and housekeeping kept my room spotless! It felt like home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, we will be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: bobwill_11
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Helpful staff. Excellent location. Good food. Recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shazza671101
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just got back from a tour in Italy , In Rome we stayed at this hotel which we rated as one of the best of the many we stayed in . Friendly very available staff that were more than happy to help us in any query we had . The hotel is very central and a good point of the city to access all parts of Rome with the metropolitan at a few minutes of distance . Rooms very clean and well taken care of , spacious .. we honestly could not have asked for more. we highly reccomend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to Rome . We are all sorry to be back home , but almost certainly we shall return next summer if not before . Exceptional staff ..really ready to assist , we don't speak Italian , but it was no problem at all .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and standards!”
Reviews.Author: Drewreadi
Reviews.Content: Staff were very accommodating and friendly. The room was very large, bigger than I've had at other hotels and impeccably clean. The hotel is ideally located for sight seeing and only a stones throw from the station. I'll definitely be back when next in Rome! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice common areas but rooms shabby!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeybunny1950
Reviews.Content: Our tour group spent 2 nights in Rome at this hotel and I can say it was certainly the only hotel throughout our tour of Italy that was in need of room refurbishing and definately in need of housekeeping services. Upon entering our room I went to the window and observed a 2 inch smear of blood on the sheer curtain, the covering of my bed had some kind of staining on the inside(next to sheet) and when I went to find a blanket for the bed I found a very worn, brown, stained one in the closet. I wanted to change rooms but hubby had already unpacked his clothes and said"don't go near the window and it's only a 2 night stay". Later that night I went to take a shower and grabbed a large towel to dry off and saw long black hairs on the towel- not a towel anyone would want to use!! I did relate the problems to the desk personnel but quite frankly, they either didn't understand English or chose to ignore me.. The stairs leading up to other levels of the hotel had clumps of debris in corners.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, thieves!”
Reviews.Author: Eva707
Reviews.Content: At arrival, hotel was nice - big, spacy. Rooms smelled a bit but the balcony full of greenery was magnificent, looking over a courtyard with palms. BUT! On the last of our 3 nights there was a robbery attempt in our room (No 229) through the open balcony door at 1am. Shocking. Even more shocking how the reception staff was calm about it, promised to call police but they never came. After our repeated inquiry, they said it was probably a drunk neighbour guest! What? this was a professional thief, dressed in tight dark clothes and disappearing super fast after we disturbed him. Hotel staff behaviour was ALARMING. After checking out, I filed a complaint with the hotel but never got answered. The breakfast was mediocre, bread missing every morning. Im glad we got out with all our cameras, mobile phones and computers... and lives... you never know. Cannot recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm with easy access to all that is Roman”
Reviews.Author: Sally-Ann56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights to attend a Conference nearby. For us then the location was perfect, just a few minutes walk. For sightseeing, we found it great – once we had found the shortcut through the tunnel under the Termini main station. We booked the hotel partly as it was the chosen one for conference delegates, and also because not knowing Rome it seemed reasonably priced and in the right area for our convenience We found the hotel comfortable, if basic. Our double room was 150 euros (with a conference discount). It was small but perfectly adequate. We were delighted to find a private foliage covered balcony through the double French windows, complete with table and two chairs, overlooking a small, tree covered private square. Furnishings were adequate and included a mini fridge. (We already knew via this site that there were no tea and coffee making facilities, so our trusty travel kettle came into its own, and the fridge kept milk etc chilled.) The room was clean and cleaned during our stay. The bed was, fortunately, very comfortable. I was able to access the wi-fi, and also the staff assisted me to use (foc) the downstairs public computers to check in online and print off our boarding cards. (always good that is!) The front desk staff when I arrived spoke very little English, but we managed between us, and they appreciated our trying to speak Italian, even if only the basic civilities. Continental Breakfast is served in a fourth floor conservatory type room, with trees and plants abounding, which we found very fresh and pleasant in the mornings. We were particularly impressed by the quietness of the area, and slept soundly, some colleagues staying in cheaper facilities had much noisier experiences. The Hotel doesn’t have its own restaurant but there are several small family owned trattorias within 5 minutes walk, where we had delightful meals, with plentiful local wine, and very cheap bills.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for the University, large rooms, nice breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoLP
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located if you have a meeting at the University or one of the nearby research institution (as it was my case), the place has little charm, but I got a very large room that certainly was pleasant. Bathroom was OK, and the breakfast on the covered roof garden is also pleasant (although don't hope for anything fancy for breakfast). Again, not a fancy place but certainly more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable - but definitely nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kymberand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights to attend a business meeting located at Università degli Studi di Roma La Sapienza. For this, the location was perfect, just a few minutes walk. For sightseeing, I would say it is not great - it is a rather long walk to get anywhere at all. On the other hand the train station Termini is rather close. I should start by saying I usually try to rate hotels according to the typical standard and cost for that location, but since this hotel was booked for me by the organizers and I have visited Rome only once before, I do not really know the standard. However I have visited other parts of Italy and most other European capitals so hopefully this assessment is fair. I found the hotel acceptable, but very basic. The single room was 140 euros (possibly with a business discount, but I am not sure) and very small, with only basic furnishings, and acceptably but not perfectly clean. The bed was, unfortunately, terribly uncomfortable. There was apparently wireless internet but I didn't manage to get a signal. The front desk staff when I arrived spoke very little English. The hotel is listed as 4 stars, but I am not sure what this is based on. There is a free buffet breakfast served in a lovely room - the food is limited and not great (mostly pastries, but also some fresh fruit). However I have found it is unusual to get breakfast at all in Italy, so this was a plus. Overall, the hotel was fine but the cost felt rather high for the quality (especially given it is not centrally located). As I mentioned I am not sure of the standard in Rome, but colleagues staying a few streets away paid considerably less for essentially the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgaryk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for a two-night stay at the beginning of our tour. My single room was clean and comfortable. People complaining about bedbugs should be aware that all over Italy, there are small red ants that live inside travertine. If you sit on walls made of this, you will bring the ants back with you, and they will bite! There is graffiti all over Rome, it is not gang-related but political, so no need to be afraid. There is no restaurant at the hotel apart from the buffet breakfast, but there are a few within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: Almea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of tour group - got a double room on 2nd floor looking out to street. Room was spacious with comfortable bed (no sign of bed bugs from previous reviews thank goodness!). The bathroom was fine, except for the side panel of the door which appeared to be falling off. The air-conditioning though was not functioning well resulting in a rather warm room despite the thermostat reading 12 degrees (this appeared to be the case in all rooms). As the windows opened out onto the main street I was hesitant to leave them open overnight. There is free internet in their computer room with 2 terminals, and also wifi but the signal is variable depending on where your room is located. Staff were generally friendly and helpful. I did not get a chance to explore the area around the hotel, but it did not seem too far from the various tourist sites by bus.

Reviews.Title: “the best place for a romantic week-end”
Reviews.Author: earthfriends
Reviews.Content: I spent a week-end in Rome with my partner and I had the pleasure to stay in such a cosy hotel. Our room (312) was very big with a window overlooking a quiet and beauiful courtyard. Staff was extremly helpful and in particular I would like to thank Valentina who went over her way to help with all the requests we had. Hotel has not restuarant but there are plenty around so you should not be worried for that Very well connected with public transportation. Rich breakfast served on a beautiful roof garden Mike

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: RichardDerry
Reviews.Content: Third time in Rome. This is by far the best hotel. Big and comfortable rooms, lovely courtyard , great terrace where to have breakfast, lovely and helpful staff. And the owner Ms. Anna ... such a lovely, charming and full of attention lady If you want to feel at home in Rome this is the place to stay Richard

Reviews.Title: “If you go here you will have a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: doggiedogToronto
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a place! We had been looking forward to the Rome part of our tour so much and this hotel did not let us down. Good location, friendly staff, big rooms and even a garden space to enjoy a drink in the evening. The breakfast is served on the top floor terrace, from where you have a great view. I would be more then happy to come back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: sc0tlandtravels
Reviews.Content: Dirty bathroom. No air condition that worked. Dirty room. and BED BUGS - more then one person on tour was bitten.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Wimbledonblond
Reviews.Content: Ok, so back in Rome again! And this time we got it right! Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and what a little gem we found! And finally a room where we both fit in together. We even had a little private pateo where we sat one of the evenings. This hotel has it all as far as I am concerned. Location; walking distance from the central station and easy to get to all the main attractions and shops. It is in a quiet street so no noice at night. Very friendly staff that helped us a lot when we had to spend the first two days trying to get my suitcase back from Airfrance! Breakfast: better than most ones I had in Italy. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robbo44Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a Trafalgar Tour.Was supposed to be a first class hotel. Definitely not. Located in a terrible part of the city where I have never seen grafitti like it. The staff in the main were disinterested and the only highlight was the very pleasant breakfast area. We did not know what to expect reading the previous reviews regarding thefts so we did not use the room safe. The hotel was being refurbished. We would in no way stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a vey enjoyable stay here with Insight Tour”
Reviews.Author: Amica25
Reviews.Content: I woulld like to thank you from Hotel Staff who helped us to go to hospital, then called a private doctor to come to our room to visit my wife who was very sick. Also I would like to thank you Hotel Staff who took me to pharmacy to buy medicine, thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Cash stolen from locked safe in room 112”
Reviews.Author: eltoroCanada
Reviews.Content: II stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in March 2009 as part of an Insight vacations tour. I put money in the safe which was located in the hotel room, the safe has a combination lock. When we checked the safe we found that cash was missing (750 Euros). The hotel staff including the duty manager did not give a dam, they refused to call the police, thank God for the tour director for Insight who was very helpful. The tour director and me had to walk about a mile through a very seedy part of Rome to locate a police station, even though the police were very helpful we were still there for about 2 1/2 hours. I have a police report and a report from insight vacations. Given my personal experience and the track record of this hotel I would not recommend it to anyone. The rest of the tour with Insight was excellent. The tour director form Insight could not have been more helpful, however I am still out 750 Euros and I have not yet heard form Insight vacations, in my customer feedback form at the end of the trip I indicated that I thought that Insight were negligent in not informing me of previous similar problems at this hotel, I am still waiting for a reply.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to think they were being ironic using Palace, but they were not...”
Reviews.Author: TravelLab
Reviews.Content: We stayed with them as a part of an Insight tour. Oh my, words will fail to describe how much I disliked this place, it's neighborhood, but I'll try. While Paris gets a bad rap about being dirty, as of my last visit in Oct 08, it's undeserved, while Rome, the "Eternal City" where it's citizens dress so nicely, have really let their city go to pot. Graffiti everywhere, trash, homeless, beggers, gypsies, and enough people selling fake Omegas, Rolex's, Mont Blanc pens, and LV bags to choke a horse. While all this is bad, and detracts significantly from the history of this cradle of civilization, lets concentrate on the hotel. Where to start; how about mold and water damage on the walls? Or the bathroom, with it's broken toilet seat, trim coming off the door, mold in the shower. The tour director asked if we reported the seat being broken, my response is simply don't they clean it daily? Shouldn't they have noted the issues? That is the problem in a nutshell, the management does not notice. Now I've never run a hotel, but I'd be looking for new cleaning staff if they could ignore the state this place was in. The remote for the TV had no battery cover, and a year old piece of scotch tape trying (and failing ) to hold the battery in. The dining room (a bright spot by appearance in this wreck), had major issues. Our last day there the staff were in tears, and the eggs looked like warmed-over leftovers from the previous day, ugh. Seriously unhappy people not working, not bringing you coffee, and sullen when you interrupted whatever was going-on. How they can claim four stars, even in Italy, where let's be honest, hotel ratings standards don't seem to match the rest of Europe, is beyond me. To sum it up, I disliked this hotel with just about every fiber of my being. We only stayed because we were a part of a tour group, otherwise, we would have been so out-of-there. And yes, it is close to the Termini Station, but in Rome, that's not a good thing. The neighborhood is not one you want to take a casual stroll through after dinner. Even the little square in the front of the hotel, with the overflowing trash bins and permanent homeless people camped out points to this being a neighborhood in decline. It's a pity that for all the attention the people of Rome spend on looking good, they don't seem to take more pride in their beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “bugs in the bed”
Reviews.Author: peterwellington
Reviews.Content: arrived there on the 25th november, the hotel is in a very "ordinary" part of town about 2km walk from the main station. something you wouldn,t do at night. when we were ready for bed pulled the bed covers back to find a large bug running across the bed sheet and lava eggs under the pillow. the hotel staff were rude and didn,t want to know. finally after a standoff they moved us to another room. i have never stayed in a hotel were the staff are so rude and unhelpful. would not this hotel recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: tlc_too
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights as part of a Trafalgar tour. Our room was on the ground floor so had french doors out to a very private patio - nice to sit out in the evening. The room itself was very comfortable, clean and with a full bathroom with tub. Others were not so lucky having only a very small shower. The breakfast was the usual variety of pastries, cereal, yogurt, etc which is more than enough for me. The staff were very friendly even if they didn't all know alot of english - they had our keys out and ready for us before we even asked! There was only one computer set up with internet in the lobby but at least it worked - in other hotels we weren't so lucky. The hotel itself was conveniently located near the Termini train station where one could get on the Metro or catch a bus to almost anywhere in the city. There were also restaurants and grocery/wine stores handy. All in all we enjoyed our stay - this hotel had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: spartan77
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel. Nothing fancy and not located in the best area of the city. Somewhat inconvenient to get around to the main tourist sites in Rome. Some rooms have a tub/shower while some have only a very tiny shower. AIr conditioning is a joke. We complained each day and were told each day that is was being worked on. A/C cannot be left on when you leave and it didn't cool anyway. Upon return, room was often over 90 degrees. Sleeping was miserable in the heat. You can do better looking elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights in Room 310 at the Ateneo Garden Palace Hotel with Trafalgar Tours. It is located about 20 minutes walk from Termini train station. The room and bathroom exceeded our expectations because they were reasonably large (see photo), it appeared to be freshly renovated, and it overlooked the garden, so it was quiet and comfortable. We spoke with a couple who had a room across the hall who were not happy with the street noise. Air conditioning was available, but we preferred to leave the window open. We appreciated the availability of many electric outlets around the room because we often were charging two computers, a hand phone, and a digital camera all at once. We especially appreciated the free wireless Internet access in the lobby. The refrigerator in the room kept things cold, but they did not have a freezer in the hotel for our ice pack. So they kept the ice pack in ice and gave it to us on our departure. The few channels on the TV were all Italian language channels. The breakfast included cereal, ham, cheese, and yoghurt. There is a small neighborhood about a 5 minute walk away with a supermarket, a gelato store, and many restaurants. There is also a good pizza restaurant across the street. We have to estimate the value based on the TripAdvisor price because we don’t know how much the tour paid for our room. We were impressed with the facilities and with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trippingirl53
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this little hotel for three days prior to a 12 night Eastern Mediterranean Cruise. It was a lovely hotel in a quiet Rome neighborhood. Walking distance to Termini Station, and not a bad walk to historic sites in Central Historic District. Close to ancient Rome city wall. It had lovely rooms, very nice bathrooms. Many rooms overlook central court, and have balconies with tables and chairs. There is free internet service and a computer to use in a nice large parlor/sitting room. Staff was very nice. Breakfast was served each morning in a very nice dining room, and was excellent. Our stay here was pleasant and comfortable, we'll choose to stay there again, and will tell others about it. We ate in a very nice restaurant directly across the street, the food and service was excellent. The Price of the Hotel was also quite reasonable at 151.00 euros a night double occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel high in contrasts, but not a four-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A_Globe_Trotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is high in contrasts... The people running the hotel during the day are nice and friendly but they don't have clue. Don't expect to obtain any reliable information from them. The guy in charge of the hotel during the night does not speak English, so much for a four-star international hotel. Room: The room is spacious, the ceiling is high, the bed is good, the bathroom is clean. Breakfast: Beside the cappucino, which is a superb, the breakfast is substandard and is served is some kind of a basement. Amenities: They advertize Internet Access but the wifi was down the all time I was there, the one computer was crowded and didn't work all the times. Supposedly you can connect from your room but they have one cable for the entire hotel! Overall, good for tourists fasting in the morning but don't expect to conduct any business there.

Reviews.Title: “room fine, pickup driver a no show”
Reviews.Author: Lp56
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for this hotel at their internet site and also arranged for a pickup at the airport to take us to the hotel. I confirmed our pickup before we left and was told where our driver would be with a sign with our name on it. We waited over an hour and he never showed. So, we were forced to hire a taxi at the last minute for 85 euros. Our pickup was to have been for 45 euros. We presented the taxi receipt at the front desk and he said he had nothing to do with internet arrangements. I wrote the internet site when we got home and they did not even respond to my two letters. I felt we were due some compensation for waiting an hour and paying so much. The hotel room was fine and we knew the hotel was not centrally located. We were able to walk to the train station for the on and off again bus tour. We did this two days before our Insight Tour was to begin. I would rate the hotel average and the front desk staff as poor. If I go back to Rome I would look for a more centrally located hotel. I would also arrange a pickup with a private company.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Winniefan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights before group tour and 2 nights after. The rooms were a good size by European standard, quiet and clean. Our room faced into the beautiful garen courtyard that the hotel wraps around. It is a 15 min walk to the train and bus station - (not suitable to drag suitcases due to cobble stones) through a not very wonderful area - lot of graffitti etc. Too far to walk to town etc. Staff were friendly and helpful - great for the inexperienced traveller. The coffee was the best we had through all of Europe!!!! Had use of hotel computer and bar - very helpful. Don't miss the great gellateria just down the road!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend & I stopped for a weekend break in November 2004. Whoever designated this hotel a four star hotel needs to go & take a look at a proper four star hotel. The rooms are very basic, with no tea or coffee making facilities, although I will say the bathrooms are very good. Our room had very noisy air conditioning that was impossible to turn off - even the hotel staff couldn't manage it. Also there were smoke alarms with flashing lights placed directly over our bed, this was obviously very distracting when trying to sleep. The view from our room was very disappointing with graffiti everywhere, and the general area was very intimidating, not somewhere you'd like to go for a romantic walk with your partner. As for being conveniently situated for all the attractions, yeah right! by helicopter maybe! Don't even get me started on the breakfast! On the whole, VERY DISAPPOINTING

HotelInfo.Name: Ateneo Garden Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Salentini 1/3, 00185 Rome, Italy
